input: Bob is furry. Bob is white. Erin is rough. Erin is white. Fiona is round. Harry is kind. Harry is white. If Fiona is smart then Fiona is quiet. All kind, rough people are white. All kind people are furry. If someone is rough and white then they are quiet. Rough people are smart. White people are rough. If someone is smart then they are furry. If someone is round then they are kind. All furry, kind people are white. Question: Fiona is smart.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Furry Bob
axiom T2 : White Bob
axiom T3 : Rough Erin
axiom T4 : White Erin
axiom T5 : Round Fiona
axiom T6 : Kind Harry
axiom T7 : White Harry

axiom R1 : Smart Fiona → Quiet Fiona
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Rough x → White x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Furry x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ White x → Quiet x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x → Smart x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Rough x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Furry x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Kind x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Kind x → White x

theorem fiona_is_smart : Smart Fiona :=
begin
  apply R5,
  apply R6,
  apply R9 Fiona,
  split,
  apply R7,
  apply R5,
  apply R6,
  apply R9 Fiona,
  split,
  apply R7,
  apply R5,
  apply R6,
  apply R9 Fiona,
  split,
  apply R7,
  apply R5,
  apply R6,
  apply R9 Fiona,
  split,
  apply R7,
  apply R5,
  apply R6,
  exact T5,
  exact T5,
end

-- The answer is True
